column4: hi, if I want to install eclipse, will "apt-get install eclipse" install the official version of java or the "free" one ?
can't say for sure but likely the free one... - give it a go.
suppose it depends which sources you have enabled.
I don't see anything about the "sun-java-6" in the listed packages when I hit enter
maybe if I install sun-java-6 first, will won't try to install the free version ...
why don't you  just give it a go and see what happens. I have done it before a while ago. it will cry about deps later if necessary.
ok
I seem to remeber it was a bit of a pain getting the right java but the way to do it is start with eclipse and go from there.
what are you using eclipse for?
I'll need it to develop Adobe Flex applications
sorry, don't know anything about that. It is a memory hog and runs like a bag of nails...
after installing sun-java6-jre, eclipse doesn't seem to need gcj anymore... :)
see what I mean.
yeah, I see very well... :)
alternativly, I'll use it for my python development
ok, I know a little about that. I use vim... :-)
tried all the gui ide stuff and vim rocks...
I'm a vim user as well, but I thought I'd give it a try with eclipse as I have to install it for Flex
yeah, I think its the best of the ide's ...
anyway, thanks for the tips
I'm now running eclipse with the official java fine from the repos
cool, no probs, good luck!
